But given Eric Schmidt 's success, the board clearly wants to retain his guidance for the next four years. `` It's a signal to shareholders that he'll continue to steer the boat,'' Wise added. Eric Schmidt , 55, is being replaced as Google Inc. 's CEO by co-founder Larry Page.

Colin Powell , a retired Army general, said he won't decide whom to vote for until he sees all the candidates. Right now I do not see on the Republican side any one individual who I think is going to emerge at the top of the pile, he said, adding he thinks Barack Obama `` is doing a good job right now.''
